<title type="main">The Compact of the Soldiers and Pilate</title>
<description type="note">Preliminaries and introductory material omitted<lb/>The following plays have been taken from this source:</description>

<description type="note">Title: The compact of the soldiers and Pilate.
Genre: English mystery and miracle plays.
[The Compact of the Soldiers and Pilate]

Tunc evigilabunt milites sepulcri et dicit primus miles ius miles Awake Awake hillis gyn qwake And tres ben shake ful nere a-too Stonys clevyd wyttys ben revid Erys ben devid I am servid soo. 2us miles he is a-resyn þis is no nay þat was deed and colde in clay now is resyn be-lyve þis day grett woundyr it is to me He is resyn by his owyn myght And fforth he goth his wey ful ryght how xul we now us qwytte Whan Pylat doth us se. 3us miles lete us now go pilat on-too And ryght evyn so as we han sayn þe trewth we sey þat out of clay he is resyn þis day þat jewys han slayn. 4us miles I holde it best lete us nevyr rest but go we prest þat it were done All heyl pilatt in þin A-stat he is resyn up latt þat þou gast dome. Pilat What What What What Out upon the why seyst þou þat Ffy vpon the harlat how darst þou so say þou dost myn herte ryght grett greff þou lyest vpon hym fals theff howe xulde he rysyn ageyn to lyff þat lay deed in clay 1us miles ?a þow þou be nevyr so wroth And of these tydandys nevyr so loth ?itt goodly on ground on lyve he goth qwycke and levynge man Iff þou haddyst a ben þer we ware in hert þou xuldyst han had gret care And of blysse a ben ryght bare Of colore bothe pale and whan. Pilatus Or ?e com there ?e dede all swere to fyght in fere and bete and bynde All þis was trayn ?our wurdys wore vayn þis is sertayn ?ow fals I fynde. 2us miles Be þe deth þe devyl deyd we were of hym so sore Atreyd þat ffor ffer we us down leyd Ryght evyn vpon oure syde whan we were leyd upon þe grounde stylle we lay as we had be bounde we durst not ryse for a thowsand pounde ne not for all þis worlde so wyde. Pilatus Now ffy upon ?our grett bost all ?our wurchep is now lost in felde in town and in every cost men may ?ou dyspravyn now all ?our wurchep it is lorn And euery man may ?ow we scorn And bydde ?ow go syttyn in þe corn And chare a-wey þe ravyn 3us miles ?a it was hy? tyme to leyn oure bost Ffor whan þe body toke a?en þe gost he wold a frayd many An ost kynge knyght and knave ?a whan he dede ryse out of his lake þan was þer suche An erthe-quake þat all þe worlde it gan to shake þat made us ffor to rave. 4us miles ?a ?a herke ffelawys what I xal say late us not ses be nyght nor day but telle þe trewth ryght as it lay In countre where we goo And than I dare ley myn heed þat þei þat crystys lawys leed they wyl nevyr ses tyl they be deed his deth þat brought hym too. ius miles Be belyall þis was now wele ment to þis cowncell lete us consent lett us go tellyn with on Assent he is resyn up þis day. 2us miles I grawnt þer-to and þat forth ryght þat he is resyn by his owyn myght Ffor þer cam non be day nor nyght to helpe hym owte of clay. Pilatus Now jentyl serys I pray ?ow All A-byde stylle a lytyl thrall whyll þat I myn cowncel call And here of þer councell. ius miles Syr att ?our prayour we wyl abyde here in þis place a lytel tyde but tary not to longe ffor we must ryde we may not longe dwelle. Pilatus Now jentyl serys I pray ?ow here Sum good cowncel me to lere Ffor sertys serys without dwere We stounde in right grett dowte. Cayphas Now trewly sere I ?ow telle þis matere is both ffers and felle combros it is þerwith to melle And evyl to be browth a-bowte. Annas Syr pylat þou grett justyse þow þou be of wittys wyse ?it herke fful sadly with good devyse what þat þou xalt do I counsel þe be my reed þis wundyrful tale pray hem to hede and upon þis ?eve hem good mede bothe golde and sylver also. And sere I xall telle ?ow why in ?oure erys prevyly be-tweyn us thre serteynly now herk serys in ?our erys. his faciant pilatus cayphas et Annas priuatim inter se consilium quo finito dicat Annas Ffor mede doth most in every qwest and mede is mayster bothe est and west now trewly serys I hold þis best With mede men may bynde berys Cayphas Sekyr sere þis counsell is good pray þese knyhtys to chaunge þer mood ?eve them golde ffeste and ffood And þat may chaunge þer wytt. Pylatt Serys ?oure good councel I xall fulfylle now jentyl knyhtys come hedyr me tylle I pray ?ow serys of ?our good wylle no ferther þat ?e fflytt. Jentyl knyhtys I ?ow pray A bettyr sawe þat ?e say Sey þer he was cawth away with his dyscyplis be nyght Sey he was with his dyscyplis ffett I wolde ?e worn in ?oure sadelys ssett And haue here gold in a purs knett and to rome rydyth ryght. 4us miles Now syr pylatt we gon oure gatt We wyll not prate no lengere now now we haue golde no talys xul be tolde to whithtys on wolde we make þe A vow. Pilatus Now ?e men of myth as ?e han hyght Euyn so forth ryght ?oure wurdys not falle And ?e xul gon with me A-non All every-chon in to myn halle. 1us miles Now hens we go As lyth as ro And ryght evyn so As we han seyd We xul kepe counsel where so evyr we dwell We xul no talys tell be not dysmayd.
